name: Christchurch
fun_fact: Fun fact: After the devastating 2011 earthquake, Christchurch rebuilt using shipping containers as shops, caf√©s, and art galleries - the Re:START Mall became a symbol of resilience and innovation, turning disaster into the world's coolest container city!

hero_dishes.name: Canterbury Lamb
hero_dishes.description: Grass-fed lamb from the Canterbury Plains, roasted simply to showcase its quality
hero_dishes.origin_story: New Zealand lamb is world-famous, and Canterbury's vast plains produce some of the finest. Often served with mint sauce or rosemary
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Pescatore at The George, Twenty Seven Steps, Roots Restaurant

hero_dishes.name: Green-Lipped Mussels
hero_dishes.description: New Zealand's unique native mussel species, larger and sweeter than Mediterranean varieties
hero_dishes.origin_story: Found only in NZ waters, these mussels are sustainably farmed in the Marlborough Sounds nearby

hero_dishes.name: Whitebait Fritters
hero_dishes.description: Delicate fritters made with tiny transparent juvenile fish, bound with egg
hero_dishes.origin_story: A New Zealand delicacy - whitebaiting season (August-November) is taken very seriously. Sold by the kilo at premium prices
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Seasonal at upscale restaurants, South Island West Coast towns

hero_dishes.name: Paua Fritters
hero_dishes.description: Fritters made from paua (abalone) - a shellfish with iridescent shell
hero_dishes.origin_story: Paua is taonga (treasure) to MƒÅori, the shells used for traditional carving. Meat is tough unless tenderized

signature_drinks.name: Flat White
signature_drinks.description: Espresso with steamed milk - claimed invented in NZ and Australia simultaneously
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: THE coffee order - Christchurch has excellent specialty coffee culture post-earthquake

signature_drinks.name: Canterbury Wine
signature_drinks.description: Cool-climate wines from nearby Waipara Valley, especially Pinot Noir and Riesling
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Waipara is just 50km away - wine tourism is popular
